meanings.definition: Money in the form of coins or banknotes.
meanings.sent1: I used my saved cashes to buy a new toy.
meanings.sent2: The cashier counted the cashes in the register.
meanings.sent3: The piggy bank was full of shiny cashes.
meanings.sent4: Her wallet overflowed with colorful cashes.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest was filled with ancient cashes.

meanings.sent1: He cashes his paycheck every Friday.
meanings.sent2: She quickly cashes out her investments when needed.
meanings.sent3: The magician cashes his tricks into money.
meanings.sent4: The sun cashes its rays into warmth.
meanings.sent5: The ATM cashes your check into usable funds.

meanings.definition: To pay or receive money in exchange for goods or services.
meanings.sent1: She cashes her customers' payments at the end of the day.
meanings.sent2: He cashes in on his skills by offering services.
meanings.sent3: The cat cashes in treats for catching mice.
meanings.sent4: The tree cashes in nutrients from the soil.
meanings.sent5: The store cashes in on the holiday sales.
